intro: Camelina stiefelhagenii, commonly known as the Stiefelhagen's camelina, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of North America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants, and is characterized by its small, cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It produces small, elongated seed pods that contain numerous tiny seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
